action.action-desc: Mr. Donalds introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Financial Services

form.official-title: To amend the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 to require proxy voting advice businesses to disclose certain information, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Proxy Advice Disclosure Act.

section.header: Proxy voting advice business disclosure requirements
section.text: Section 14 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (15 U.S.C. 78n) is amended by adding at the end the following:

subsection.header: Proxy voting advice business disclosure requirements

paragraph.text: A proxy voting advice business that makes proxy voting advice available to a security holder shall adopt and make publicly available written policies and procedures reasonably designed to ensure that—

subparagraph.text: an issuer that is the subject of proxy voting advice has such advice made available to the issuer not later than the time when such advice is disseminated to the security holder; and

the security holder is provided with a mechanism by which the security holder can reasonably be expected to become aware of any written statements regarding such proxy voting advice by the issuer that is the subject of such advice, in a timely manner before the applicable meeting, vote, consent, or authorization.

paragraph.text: It shall be unlawful for a proxy voting advice business, in providing proxy voting advice to a security holder, to fail to disclose material information regarding the proxy voting advice, including information regarding the methodology, sources of information, or conflicts of interest of such proxy voting advice business.

subparagraph.text: With respect to a security of an issuer, the term proxy voting advice means providing a recommendation to a security holder on a specific matter of which the issuer has requested security holder approval, vote, or consent.
The term proxy voting advice business means a person that—

clause.text: holds itself out as a provider for proxy voting advice separately from other forms of investment advice; and
sells proxy voting advice for a fee.
